Sabinianus

From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
Jump to navigation Jump to search
This article is about the Roman usurper. For other uses, see Sabinian (disambiguation).
Usurper of the Roman Empire
Sabinianus
Usurper of the Roman Empire
Reign240
PredecessorGordian III
SuccessorGordian III
Full name
Marcus Asinius Sabinianus
Regnal name
Imperator Caesar Sabinianus Augustus

Reign of Aurelian (270–275)

  • Usurpation of Victorinus Junior (271)
  • Junthungi Invasion (271)

Marcus Asinius Sabinianus was proconsul of the Roman province of Africa. In 240 he led a revolt against Gordian III. He proclaimed himself emperor, but after being defeated by the governor of Mauretania, his supporters in Carthage surrendered him to the imperial authorities.

References[edit]

  • Meckler, Michael L., "Gordian III (238–244 A.D.)", De Imperatoribus Romanis
  • "R16130 Gordian III". forumancientcoins.com. Retrieved Apr 20, 2019.
